answers: I had a small meal quickly

questions.question: If you have any questions you should ask her. She doesn't bite.
Put on your coat. The wind is really biting today.
I don't think I will be able to finish that project on time. I have bitten off more than I can .......................
questions.description: To bite off more than one can chew is to take on a commitment you cannot fulfill.

questions.question: It is a tough task but I have decided to bite the .........................
questions.description: To bite the bullet is to decide to do something difficult.

questions.question: We fought  ..................... and still we couldn't win.
questions.description: To fight tooth and nail is to work really hard.

questions.question: Don't threaten her. She will ....................... back.
questions.description: To bite back is to return someone's anger.

questions.question: She scored good marks by sinking her ……………………… into her studies.
questions.description: To sink your teeth into something is to be completely involved.

questions.question: You hit the …………………….. on the head when you said that unemployment was the worst problem plaguing the society.
questions.description: To hit the nail on the head is to correctly identify the problem.

questions.question: The exam was not as tough as I expected. I think I …………………….. it.
questions.description: To nail something is to complete it successfully.
